intro: Gibbaeum tischleri, commonly known as the Tischler's knobbed pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spiky foliage and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant is part of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent properties and ability to thrive in arid environments. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Gibbaeum tischleri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
